candidate_p module¶

class candidate_p.candidate(row, col, possibleValueList)[source]¶

Bases: object

a canditate is defined as a list for one SUDOKU element that represents all possible values for that element

compare(candidate)[source]¶

compare the candidate with the self.candidate, Return True if equal, otherwise return False

getCandidate()[source]¶
removeElements(valueList)[source]¶

return value: candidate in which all values that are indentical to elements defined in valueList are removed

removeElementsNotInValueList(valueList)[source]¶

return value: candidate in which all values that are not in the value list are removed

class candidate_p.candidateList(candidateList, name='')[source]¶

Bases: object

a candidateList is the list of candidates containing candidates (such list can be defined for row, col, box or for the overall sudoku)

append(operand)[source]¶

append a candidate to the list

compare(candidateList, debugFlag=0)[source]¶

compare the candidateList with the self.candidateList, Return True if equal, otherwise return False

count(number)[source]¶

count how often the number is included in the candidate list

countOccurenceInList(possibleValueList, number)[source]¶

how often is the number included in the candidateList

findHiddenPairs(debugFlag=0)[source]¶

find hidden pairs: that are pairs that are located inside the candidate list, examples are [1,2,3,4], [1,2,6], [3,5], [4,7], [6,9] … as [1,2] can only be in the first two terms, the list can be reduced to [1,2], [1,2], [3,5], [4,7], [6,9] … note that now 3, 4, and 6 are hidden singles

findPairs(debugFlag=0)[source]¶

find (first) pairs in candidate list

findTripples(debugFlag=0)[source]¶

find (first) tripple in candidate list

getAllBoxCandidates(box)[source]¶

get all candidates for all empty cells in a box

getCandidateList()[source]¶
getHiddenSingles()[source]¶

return number of hidden singles and all hidden single candidates in the list

getPerm2()[source]¶

generate a list of all relevant 2-er permutations of a,b

getSingles()[source]¶

return number of singles and all single candidates in the list

pairs2list(pairs)[source]¶

generate a list of numbers that are inside the pairs list

reduceCandidateListBesidePairs(debugFlag=0)[source]¶

if a pair is found, remove elements of that pair in all other candidates of that candidate list

reduceCandidateListBesideTripples(debugFlag=0)[source]¶

if a pair is found, remove elements of that pair in all other candidates of that candidate list

reduceCandidateListForHiddenPairs(debugFlag=0)[source]¶

check 2-er permutations that are inside of candidateList: all values beside the 2-er permutation are removed

removeElements(valueList)[source]¶

return value: candidate list in which all candidate that are indentical to elements defined in valueList are removed

remove_pv(possibleValueList)[source]¶

remove all candidate that are identical to the possible value list

remove_rc(row, col)[source]¶

remove a candidate defined by row, col

setName(name)[source]¶
sort()[source]¶

sort the candidate list by row, col
